SENT.plain: Alkali-labile lesions introduced into T7 DNA by treatment with methyl methanesulfonate were removed and the DNA was repaired by incubation with DNA polymerase alpha and nuclease from a human lymphoblastoid line followed by the addition of DNA ligase
The nuclease preparation contains both apurinic endonuclease and 5'-3' exonuclease activities
Dinucleotides appear to be the first product of exonuclease action
Repair of methyl methanesulfonate-induced damage can occur by the insertion of only a few nucleotides per lesion as in vivo
